definition: to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
erhua variant of 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]

sentences.english: Thoughts are visitors, who visit the central station of the mind.
sentences.chinese: 想法是来大脑中央站点串门的门客。

sentences.english: Dudu bear goes to Maomao cat's home.
sentences.chinese: 嘟嘟熊到毛毛球家串门。

sentences.english: He took his two great-grandson, occasionally visited.
sentences.chinese: 他带着他的两个重孙，偶尔去串门。

sentences.english: Why don't you come round next Saturday evening?
sentences.chinese: 你下星期六晚上来串门好不？

sentences.english: She was already in her pajamas when I went to her house, so I didn't enter.
sentences.chinese: 我去他家串门时她已经穿上睡裙了，所以我就没进去。

sentences.english: Please drop in any time when you come near my house.
sentences.chinese: 什么时候到我们家附近来的时候请来串门。

sentences.english: They visited with the Hatch’s nearly every day.
sentences.chinese: 他们几乎天天去哈奇家串门。

sentences.english: Even in the dressing rooms, we go to each others' rooms a lot.
sentences.chinese: 尽管在换衣室，我们都凡是串门。

sentences.english: That afternoon Juanita dropped in to brighten Carol.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午，朱恩妮塔跑来串门，给卡罗尔解闷。

definition: see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]

to visit/to call on sb/to look around

the building or room opposite
